head.title: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Pickle Company To Pay Back Wages

hedline.hl1: Metro Briefing | New York: Brooklyn: Pickle Company To Pay Back Wages

body.head.byline: By Steven Greenhouse (NYT); Compiled by Anthony Ramirez

abstract.p: Tuv Taam Corp agrees to pay up to $860,000 in back wages plus $215,000 in damages to settle charges it paid less than minimum wage to its workers; Brooklyn pickle and delicatessen food maker was accused by Atty Gen Eliot Spitzer of violating state and federal wage laws from 1996 to 2001 (S)

block.p: The Tuv Taam Corporation, a producer of pickles, blintzes and hummus, agreed yesterday to pay up to $860,000 in back wages to 200 workers to settle charges that it paid less than minimum wage, sometimes 20 percent less. Tuv Taam, which is in Williamsburg, also agreed to pay $215,000 in damages, said Eliot Spitzer, the state attorney general. In the settlement, Tuv Taam did not admit wrongdoing. Mr. Spitzer had accused the company of violating state and federal wage laws from 1996 to 2001.
